ETYMOLOGY: From Old English nāwiht ('no thing, nothing'), a compound of nā ('no') + wiht ('thing, creature').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An adverb is a word or phrase that modifies or qualifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to form the negative of verbs, adjectives, or adverbs.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用于构成动词、形容词或副词的否定形式。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I am not going to the meeting today.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An adverb is a word or phrase that modifies or qualifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used before a noun phrase, adjective, or adverb to mean 'not at all' or to deny something strongly.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用于名词短语、形容词或副词之前，表示“一点也不”或强烈否定某事。
